page.title: 13WOODTHORPE HALL
page.content: Woodthorpe Hall is built of sandstone and has mullion windows.This 350 year old "gentleman's residence" lies south of Totley village and is surrounded by farmlands and ancient woods.It is reached by a narrow lane passing Fanshawe Gate Hall which is another privately owned ancient mansion. Currently Woodthorpe Hall is owned and occupied by the{Shepley family }who came in 1926.Its previous owners converted the Hall from its farmhouse use when the ground floor rooms were used as a kitchen,living room,stable, and cowshed and upstairs was storage for hay and grain. Delightful gardens with lawns,flower borders, and trees surround the house. Set in one wall is an unusual gate.Its posts have carved in them a happy and a sad face.This is the work of the present owner.
